model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I booked an excursion to visit the Acropolis in Athens, thank you so much for your advice. Can you tell me about it?
Speaker B: Yes!  You can't miss it, especially if you are staying in the Plaka neighborhood.   The acroplis sits on the top of the big hill.  You can see if from  much of the surrounding neighborhoods.   I would recommend visiting the museum that is there first to learn all about what you are about to see. 
Speaker A: I definitely will, this sounds like such an amazing trip. How long has it been since you've been there yourself?
Speaker B: I was in Greece last two years ago.   I am excited to go again soon!    At somepoint I would like to take a cruise around the islands there.  It seems like a neat way to see all the Islands in an easy way.   Have you ever taken a cruise?
Speaker A: Only once before when I was very young, so I don't remember much. It sounds like such a relaxing way to enjoy the day, though. Maybe we can plan a cruise together sometime.
Speaker B: That would be fun!  I go to Europe a lot so maybe a cruise in the Caribbean would be nice.  I would like to see Saint Lucia and Saint Thomas. 
Speaker A: Oh, Europe? I'm already sold on the idea, sounds like a blast! I've never had a negative experience in Europe. Should we visit some of the capital cities?

MEMORY:
Speaker B is planning a trip to Greece in the next three months with a family of five because Speaker B has three kids. 
Speaker B is excited about visiting Greece for the first time and loves Athena, considering her a perfect goddess for a librarian. Speaker B is planning a trip to Greece in the next three months with a family of five. Speaker B asks Speaker A if their trip is more for relaxation or sightseeing. 
Speaker A has traveled around Europe before, visiting capital cities of each country because Speaker A has kids and is familiar with Greek mythology. Speaker A booked a plane ticket to Rome on a whim and is leaving in two weeks.

speaker: Speaker B
raw_prediction: Absolutely! Visiting the capital cities in Europe is such a great way to experience the history and culture of each country. I'm sure we'll have an amazing time exploring!
prediction:
Brief explanation: The MEMORY contains information about Speaker B planning a trip to Greece in the next three months, which can be seen as relevant since Speaker A is discussing booking an excursion in Athens and going on a cruise with Speaker B. However, the MEMORY also says Speaker B has never been to Greece before (and is excited about their first visit), which is contradictory to the DIALOGUE CONTEXT where Speaker B mentions they were in Greece two years ago. Therefore, the MEMORY doesn't align accurately with the current conversation and, as such, contains confusing and potentially misleading information rather than helpfully relevant information for Speaker B to generate a response.

Judgement: No
